intro: Tetrapterys crebriflora f. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandular-leaved tetrapterys, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its glandular-pubescent leaves, which are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
